summary: I HAVE PURCHASED A 1999 DODGE RAM 1500 SPORT.  THE DASH HAS HAD A PROBLEM IN THE PAST AND CRACKED AND SPLIT.  I HAVE REPLACED IT BUT EXPECT THAT IT WILL HAPPEN AGAIN.  THE PROBLEM IS WHEN THIS OCCURS DURING AN ACCIDENT, THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR THE BROKEN PIECES OF THE BRITTLE PLASTIC TO BECOME SHRAPNEL AND PUNCTURE OR BECOME A FLYING PROJECTILE IN THE CAB OF THE VEHICLE.  IF IT IS CAUGHT BY THE AIRBAG, THE SPEED CAN BE ACCELERATED WHEN THE AIRBAG DEPLOYS.    WHEN WILL NHTSA ISSUE A RECALL ON THE DASHBOARD OF THESE TRUCKS.  THE BEZEL AND THE GLOVEBOX'S ARE ALSO SPLITTING AS WELL.    WHEN CAN THE RECALL BE EXPECTED.  I HAVE NOTED BEFORE THAT THIS PROBLEM EXIST ON NHTSA'S WEBSITE UNDER SEVERAL CATEGORIES..  IT IS A SAFETY ISSUE IF THE DASH CRACKS OR BREAKS OFF DURING AN ACCIDENT.      OWNERS ARE WAITING FOR A RECALL SO THAT THEY DO NOT CONTINUE TO HAVE TO PULL MONEY OUT OF THERE POCKET TO FIX REPAIRS ON ITEMS THAT SHOULD NOT HAVE A PROBLEM.
